title.self: Low mood + reduced interest pattern (reflection view)

description.clinician: Criteria coverage view for MDD-style symptom pattern; not an automated diagnosis.
description.self: A way to reflect on themes in mood, interest, energy, and daily functioning over time.

description.clinician: Low mood most of the day (as described by the person or observed).
description.self: Feeling down, empty, or sad for much of the day.

description.clinician: In children and adolescents, mood can be irritable rather than depressed.
Noticeably less interest/pleasure in most activities.
description.self: Things that usually matter feel less engaging.

description.clinician: Significant appetite or weight change (up or down).
description.self: Eating noticeably more/less, or weight shifts you’ve noticed.

description.clinician: In children, consider failure to make expected weight gain.
Insomnia or hypersomnia (sleeping too little or too much).
description.self: Trouble sleeping, waking often, or sleeping much more than usual.

description.clinician: Observable restlessness or slowed movements/speech.
description.self: Feeling unusually restless, or like everything takes extra effort and time.

description.clinician: Observable restlessness or agitation.
Low energy or fatigue nearly every day.
description.self: Feeling drained, heavy, or exhausted.

description.clinician: Feelings of worthlessness or disproportionate guilt; not merely self-reproach or guilt about being sick.
description.self: Feeling like you’re a burden, not enough, or blaming yourself intensely.

description.clinician: Exclude if guilt is merely related to being sick.
Reduced ability to think, concentrate, or make decisions.
description.self: Brain fog, indecision, or difficulty staying on track.

description.clinician: Thoughts about death/self-harm or suicidal ideation/behavior.
description.self: Feeling unsafe, hopeless, or having thoughts about not wanting to be here.

description.clinician: Must be thoughts of death, not just fear of dying.
Requires at least 5 symptoms from the defined symptom set.
description.self: How many different themes are showing up.

description.clinician: Requires at least one core symptom to be present (mood or interest).
description.self: At least one core theme is showing up.

description.clinician: Symptoms cluster within the same minimum time window; indicates a meaningful change from baseline.
description.self: How long this has been going on, and whether it feels like a change.

description.clinician: Interval of at least 2 consecutive months between separate episodes in which criteria are not met for an MDE.
To classify as Recurrent, there must be an interval of at least 2 consecutive months between separate episodes where MDE criteria were not met.
Indicates notable impact on work, school, relationships, or self-care.
description.self: Where this is showing up in your day-to-day life.

description.clinician: During the past 2 months, no significant signs or symptoms of the disturbance were present.
Full criteria not met or symptom-free period is less than 2 months.
Exclude if there is clear evidence of manic/hypomanic episodes.
description.self: Some people also have periods of unusually high energy or racing thoughts—worth discussing.

description.clinician: The manic/hypomanic exclusion does not apply if episodes were substance-induced or attributable to another medical condition.
Exclude or flag if symptoms are better explained by substances or medical conditions.
description.self: Sometimes sleep, meds, substances, or health issues affect mood—worth exploring.

description.clinician: Disturbance is not better explained by schizoaffective disorder, schizophrenia, or other psychotic disorders.
Generated when key gates remain unknown.
description.self: Questions that might help you understand the pattern better.

description.clinician: Differentiation based on affect, thought content, and self-esteem preservation.

evaluator_hints.affect_pattern: Grief: Emptiness/loss in waves that decrease over days; MDE: Persistent depressed mood not tied to specific thoughts.
evaluator_hints.self_esteem: Grief: Self-esteem preserved; MDE: Worthlessness and self-loathing are common.
evaluator_hints.thought_content: Grief: Preoccupation with deceased; MDE: Self-critical, pessimistic ruminations.
evaluator_hints.death_ideation: Grief: Thoughts of joining the deceased; MDE: Thoughts of ending life due to worthlessness/pain.
evaluator_hints.humor_capacity: Grief: Pain may be accompanied by positive emotions/humor; MDE: Pervasive unhappiness/misery.

description.clinician: In Grief: affect is emptiness/loss, occurs in waves ('pangs'), self-esteem preserved. In MDE: mood is persistent depressed/inability to anticipate happiness, self-loathing is common.

evaluator_hints.note_1_grief_vs_mde: Flag if affect is 'emptiness and loss' (grief) vs 'persistent depressed mood' (MDE). In grief, self-esteem is preserved; in MDE, worthlessness is common.
evaluator_hints.cultural_gate: Do not include symptoms if they are culturally sanctioned responses to a common stressor or loss.

coding_metadata.catatonia_coding: Use additional code 293.89 (F06.1) if catatonic features are present.
coding_metadata.psychotic_features_coding: Code 'with psychotic features' specifier irrespective of episode severity.

coding_priority_rules.instruction: If psychotic features are present, use the psychotic code regardless of severity (Mild/Mod/Severe).
If remission specifiers are present, ignore severity codes (Mild/Mod/Severe). Use Remission codes from Source table.

coding_metadata.medical_condition_ordering: For depressive disorder due to another medical condition, list the medical condition code/name first, immediately before the mental disorder.

evaluator_hints.differential_note: PDD lacks 4 symptoms present in MDE. If an individual has 2+ years of symptoms but meets MDE criteria rather than PDD, assign MDD.
evaluator_hints.child_variant_note: In children/adolescents, duration requirement is reduced to 1 year.

description.clinician: Onset of symptoms is before age 21 years.
Onset of symptoms is at age 21 years or older.
Coverage view for PDD-style chronic pattern.
description.self: Reflection view for longer-term patterns.

description.clinician: Low mood most days over an extended period.
description.self: Feeling down more days than not.

description.clinician: In children and adolescents, mood can be irritable rather than depressed.

labels.self: How long this has been present

description.clinician: Minimum duration gate for chronic pattern.
description.self: Has this been around for a long time?

description.clinician: During the 2-year period, the individual has never been without symptoms for more than 2 months at a time.
At least 2 secondary symptoms present.
description.self: Multiple related themes show up.

description.clinician: Appetite changes.
description.self: Eating more/less than usual.

description.clinician: Sleep disruption.
description.self: Trouble sleeping or sleeping too much.

description.clinician: Fatigue/low energy.
description.self: Feeling drained.

description.clinician: Low self-worth.
description.self: Feeling inadequate or diminished.

description.clinician: Concentration issues.
description.self: Brain fog or indecision.

description.clinician: Hopelessness.
description.self: Feeling like things won’t change.

description.clinician: Disturbance is not better explained by schizoaffective disorder, schizophrenia, or other psychotic disorders.
If full MDE criteria are met at any point during the current 2-year episode, assign MDD.

evaluator_hints.note: PDD lacks 4 symptoms present in MDE; if these 4 are met, MDD is the correct diagnosis.

description.clinician: Have full criteria for a Major Depressive Episode been met at any point in the preceding 2 years?
Have full criteria for a Major Depressive Episode been met continuously throughout the preceding 2-year period?

evaluator_hints.cooccurrence_permission: DMDD can coexist with ADHD, Conduct Disorder, and Substance Use Disorders.
evaluator_hints.anticipation_exception: Developmentally appropriate mood elevation (e.g., anticipation of a highly positive event) does not count as manic/hypomanic symptoms.

description.clinician: Coverage view for DMDD-style pattern.
description.self: Reflection view for outbursts/irritability.

description.clinician: Recurrent severe outbursts.
description.self: Moments where emotions escalate quickly.

description.clinician: Outbursts occur frequently on average.
description.self: How often these moments happen.

description.clinician: Persistently irritable mood most of the day is observable by parents, teachers, or peers.
No period of 3+ consecutive months without symptoms in Criteria A–D.
Present in >= 2 of 3 settings (home, school, peers) and severe in at least one.

labels.self: How long this has been present

description.clinician: Pattern persists over time with limited gaps.
description.self: Has this pattern been ongoing?

description.clinician: Onset/age constraints gate.
description.self: When this started can matter.

description.clinician: Cannot coexist with Bipolar, ODD, or Intermittent Explosive Disorder. If ODD/DMDD both met, only DMDD is assigned.
There has never been a distinct period lasting more than 1 day during which full manic/hypomanic criteria were met.
Developmentally appropriate mood elevation (e.g., anticipating a positive event) is not counted as mania.
DMDD cannot coexist with ODD, IED, or Bipolar Disorder. If ODD and DMDD criteria are both met, diagnose DMDD only.
Behaviors do not occur exclusively during an episode of major depressive disorder.

title.self: Monthly mood and physical pattern (reflection view)

naming_rules.instruction: Append 'Provisional' if diagnosis is based on retrospective history rather than 2 cycles of prospective daily ratings.

description.clinician: Symptoms present week before menses, improve within days of onset, absent postmenses.
description.self: Patterns that show up before your period and clear up shortly after it starts.

description.clinician: Criteria A–C met for most cycles in the preceding year.
Criterion A confirmed by daily ratings during at least two symptomatic cycles.

metadata.recording_procedure: If ratings are incomplete, record as 'Premenstrual dysphoric disorder, provisional'.

description.clinician: The disturbance is not merely an exacerbation of the symptoms of another disorder (e.g., MDD, Panic Disorder, PDD).
Symptoms are not attributable to the physiological effects of a substance or another medical condition (e.g., hyperthyroidism).

title.self: Mood changes related to substances or medications

description.clinician: Depressed mood or anhedonia predominates the clinical picture.
Developed during/soon after intoxication, withdrawal, or exposure.
Symptoms preceded use or persist ~1 month after cessation.

coding_metadata.icd_10_variations: ICD-10 position 4 is '1' for mild use disorder, '2' for moderate/severe, and '9' if no comorbid use disorder exists.
coding_metadata.naming_convention: Record comorbid use disorder first (if any), then 'with', then substance-induced depressive disorder.

icd_10_dynamic_logic.base_instruction: Select code row based on substance class (e.g., Cocaine = F14).

fourth_character_rules.instruction: Record only the substance-induced depressive disorder.

title.clinician: Depressive Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
title.self: Mood changes related to physical health

description.clinician: Full criteria are not met for a major depressive episode.
Full criteria are met (except Criterion C) for a major depressive episode.
Symptoms of mania or hypomania are also present but do not predominate.
Evidence that the disturbance is the direct consequence of a medical condition.

coding_metadata.recording_order: Record the medical condition code/name first, immediately followed by the depressive disorder due to another medical condition.
coding_metadata.medical_condition_ordering: The code and name for the etiological medical condition must be listed first, immediately before the mental disorder name.

with_depressive_features.criteria: Full criteria not met for Major Depressive Episode.

with_major_depressive_like_episode.criteria: Full criteria met (except Criterion C) for Major Depressive Episode.

with_mixed_features.criteria: Symptoms of mania/hypomania present but do not predominate.

description.clinician: Depressed mood + 4 symptoms for 2-13 days, at least once per month, for 12 months.
Depressed affect + 4 symptoms for 4-13 days.
Depressed affect + 1 symptom for at least 2 weeks.
Depressed mood + 4 symptoms for 2-13 days monthly for >= 12 months.
Depressed affect + 4 of 8 MDD symptoms for 4-13 days.
Pattern 2 (Short-duration) is only diagnosed if criteria for Pattern 1 (Recurrent Brief) are not met.
Depressed affect + at least 1 other MDD symptom for >= 2 weeks.
Pattern 3 (Insufficient symptoms) is only diagnosed if criteria for Mixed Anxiety/Depressive Disorder are not met.

labels.clinician: History: Never met other Depressive/Bipolar criteria

description.clinician: Used when information is insufficient for a more specific diagnosis.

labels.clinician: History: Never met other Depressive/Bipolar criteria

description.clinician: External diagnosis referenced for DMDD hierarchy exclusion.
External diagnosis referenced for OSDD exclusion.

specifiers.title: With melancholic features
specifiers.logic: Requires at least one core (anhedonia/nonreactivity) plus 3 of 6 secondary melancholic symptoms.

description.clinician: Mood is qualitatively different, not merely 'more severe' or 'longer lasting'.
Mood does not brighten at all, or brightens only partially (e.g., up to 20%–40% of normal for only minutes at a time).
Apply melancholic features if present during the most severe stage of the current episode.

nodes.label: Loss of pleasure in all activities
Lack of reactivity to pleasurable stimuli
Depression regularly worse in the morning

specifiers.title: With atypical features
specifiers.logic: Requires mood reactivity plus 2 or more atypical symptoms; excludes melancholic/catatonia.

description.clinician: Criteria not met for melancholic or catatonic features in the same episode.
At least 10 hours of sleep per day or at least 2 hours more than when not depressed.
Total sleep >= 10 hours/day OR >= 2 hours more than non-depressed baseline.
Feeling heavy or weighted down for at least 1 hour per day.
Feeling heavy, leaden, or weighted down (arms/legs) present for at least 1 hour a day.
Long-standing trait that persists even when the individual is not depressed.
Must be a long-standing trait (early onset, persists in adult life) occurring when depressed AND when not depressed.

labels.clinician: With intermittent major depressive episodes, with current episode

description.clinician: Full MDE criteria currently met, but periods of >= 8 weeks in past 2 years were sub-threshold.

labels.clinician: With intermittent major depressive episodes, without current episode

description.clinician: Full MDE criteria not currently met, but one or more MDEs occurred in the preceding 2 years.
If onset is at age 21 years or older.
Symptoms present but full criteria not met, OR period < 2 months without symptoms.
No significant signs/symptoms present during the past 2 months.
Few symptoms in excess of required; distressing but manageable; minor impairment.
Number/intensity of symptoms and impairment are between mild and severe.
Symptoms substantially in excess; seriously distressing/unmanageable; marked interference.

labels.clinician: Fear that something awful may happen
Feeling that the individual might lose control

exclusion_criteria.criteria: Pattern is better explained by seasonally linked psychosocial stressors (e.g., unemployment, school schedule).

description.clinician: Seasonal episodes must substantially outnumber nonseasonal episodes over the individual’s lifetime.
Seasonal episodes must substantially outnumber nonseasonal episodes over the individual's lifetime.
Characterized by low energy, hypersomnia, overeating, weight gain, and a craving for carbohydrates.
Full remissions (or a change from major depression to mania or hypomania) also occur at a characteristic time of the year.
Pattern is NOT better explained by seasonally linked psychosocial stressors (e.g., seasonal unemployment, school schedule).
No nonseasonal episodes of that polarity have occurred in the last 2 years.

evaluator_hints.prevalence_context: Risk varies by latitude, age, and sex; higher at higher latitudes and in younger individuals.

description.clinician: Content is consistent with typical depressive themes (inadequacy, guilt, disease, death, nihilism, punishment).
Content does not involve typical depressive themes, or is a mixture.
Periods of at least 8 weeks in at least the preceding 2 years with symptoms below the threshold for a full MDE.

evaluator_hints.comorbidity_note: Severe anxiety and panic attacks are frequent in peripartum episodes.
evaluator_hints.safety_risk_alert: High risk of infanticide associated with peripartum psychotic features (command hallucinations/delusions of possession).
evaluator_hints.onset_clarification: 50% of peripartum episodes begin prior to delivery.

description.clinician: Clinical picture is dominated by 3 (or more) of the following symptoms.

specifiers.logic: ICD-10 position 4 is '1' for mild use disorder, '2' for moderate/severe, and '9' if no comorbid use disorder exists.
specifiers.naming_rule: Diagnostic name must begin with the specific substance (e.g., 'Cocaine-induced depressive disorder').

specifiers.logic: The code and name for the etiological medical condition must be listed first, immediately before the mental disorder name.
specifiers.example: 244.9 (E03.9) hypothyroidism; 293.83 (F06.31) depressive disorder due to hypothyroidism, with depressive features.

description.clinician: At least 3 manic/hypomanic symptoms present nearly every day.

labels.clinician: More talkative than usual or pressure to keep talking
Flight of ideas or racing thoughts
Increase in energy or goal-directed activity
Excessive involvement in activities with painful consequences
